bioghist.p: Items donated by Dr. Casey A. Wood (1856-1942), founder of the Library of Ornithology at McGill University and collector of manuscripts, W. W. Hyde of the University of Pennsylvania, and Dr. James B. Thompson.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of ola leaf books (palm leaf pages with wooden covers) and other artifacts. Items in the collection include: a 17th century ola on diseases and their treatments in Pali-Sinhalese; a 1905 ola of stories and fables about Shiva in Tamil; part of a treatise on arithmetic, undated; a fragment of a Pali (Buddhist) manuscript on strips of palm leaves (unbound); and a typed description of ola leaf books and how they are made. The collection also includes: fragments of biblical text in Hebrew on vellum or parchment, undated; fragments from Exodus, Genesis, and Deuteronomy; a small accordion palm leaf volume, undated (unidentified script); accordion paper text in an unidentified script, undated; and a large leather roll with ink script (possibly Hebrew) and a wooden scroll handle.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
